docs.snippet: A day after the funeral of one of two police officers gunned down in their patrol car, the city's police commissioner called Sunday for a "lot less rhetoric and a lot more dialogue" to defuse the tension between police officers and the population ...

headline.main: Police Boss: Less Rhetoric, More Dialogue Needed
headline.print_headline: Police Boss: Less Rhetoric, More Dialogue Needed

docs.lead_paragraph: A day after the funeral of one of two police officers gunned down in their patrol car, the city's police commissioner called Sunday for a "lot less rhetoric and a lot more dialogue" to defuse the tension between police officers and the population they protect.

docs.snippet: Italian and Greek helicopter crews worked into the night to airlift passengers off a burning ferry adrift in the Adriatic Sea, battling darkness and bad weather that hampered rescue efforts by other ships throughout Sunday....

docs.snippet: When brothers Amir and Mosha Jan joined Afghanistan's police two years ago they believed that their patriotic duty was more important than obeying their father, who did not want his only sons joining the ranks of a police force on the front lines ...

headline.main: Afghan Police Lead Insurgent Fight at High Cost
headline.print_headline: Afghan Police Lead Insurgent Fight at High Cost

docs.lead_paragraph: When brothers Amir and Mosha Jan joined Afghanistan's police two years ago they believed that their patriotic duty was more important than obeying their father, who did not want his only sons joining the ranks of a police force on the front lines of the war against the Taliban.

docs.snippet: Cuba's most prominent dissidents say they have been kept in the dark by U.S. officials over a list of 53 political prisoners who will be released from jail as part of a deal to end decades of hostility between the United States and Cuba....

headline.print_headline: In U.S.-Cuba Prisoner Swap, Mystery Surrounds the Unnamed 53

docs.snippet: South Korea's nuclear power operator said on Sunday that cyberattacks on non-critical operations at the company's headquarters are continuing but the country's nuclear power plants are operating safely and are secure from attack....

headline.main: South Korea Nuclear Operator Says Cyberattacks Continue, Reactors Safe
headline.print_headline: South Korea Nuclear Operator Says Cyberattacks Continue, Reactors Safe

docs.lead_paragraph: South Korea's nuclear power operator said on Sunday that cyberattacks on non-critical operations at the company's headquarters are continuing but the country's nuclear power plants are operating safely and are secure from attack.

docs.snippet: FRIEDBERG--Florence, 90, died suddenly after a period of declining health, on December 26, 2014 at St. Francis Hospital in Roslyn, NY. She is survived by her loving husband of 72 years, Barry Friedberg, her devoted children Diane and Marc Houslang...
docs.lead_paragraph: FRIEDBERG--Florence, 90, died suddenly after a period of declining health, on December 26, 2014 at St. Francis Hospital in Roslyn, NY. She is survived by her loving husband of 72 years, Barry Friedberg, her devoted children Diane and Marc Houslanger and Richard Friedberg and Courtenay Dodge; her grandchildren Michelle Houslanger, Joseph Houslanger, Sarah and Max Krohn, Hannah and David Orowitz; a great-grandchild Genevieve Krohn, and her sister Beatrice Segal. Florence was born in New York City on May 4, 1924 to Betty and Samuel Schick and graduated from Theodore Roosevelt High School in 1942. She was a devoted mother and wife and also enjoyed painting and volunteering at various charities. Along with her husband, she was engaged in a variety of philanthropic projects both in Nassau County, NY and Boca Raton, FL. She knew love was her highest priority. She and her husband were also very active in Temple B'nai Israel in Elmont, NY. The funeral service, under the direction of Gutterman's, will be held on Monday, December 29th at Temple B'nai Israel, 471 Elmont Road, Elmont, NY with services conducted by Rabbi Samuel Kehati. Burial will follow at Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, NY. In lieu of flowers, donations may be sent to the Barry and Florence Friedberg JCC in Oceanside, NY, Temple B'nai Israel of Elmont, or a charity of the donor's choice. May her memory be a blessing.
